title: Inheritance in Ruby
description:
Practice class inheritance and method overriding.

Steps:
1. Implement `Animal.new` so `Animal.new('Generic').speak` returns "Some sound".
2. Implement `Dog.new` so `Dog.new('Buddy').is_a?(Animal)` returns true; `Dog.new('Buddy').speak` returns "Woof! I'm Buddy"; `Dog.new('Max').speak` returns "Woof! I'm Max".
3. Implement `Cat.new` so `Cat.new('Whiskers').is_a?(Animal)` returns true; `Cat.new('Whiskers').speak` returns "Meow! I'm Whiskers".

Expected results:
- `Animal.new('Generic').speak` returns "Some sound"
- `Dog.new('Buddy').is_a?(Animal)` returns true
- `Dog.new('Buddy').speak` returns "Woof! I'm Buddy"
- `Dog.new('Max').speak` returns "Woof! I'm Max"
- `Cat.new('Whiskers').is_a?(Animal)` returns true
- `Cat.new('Whiskers').speak` returns "Meow! I'm Whiskers"
